meta.name: Abstract
meta.desc: Gives a short summary of the description.

meta.name: Author
meta.desc: Declare the author of the HTML or XML document.

meta.name: Cache Control
meta.desc: Allows Web publishers to define how pages should be handled by caches.

meta.name: Content Language
meta.desc: Declares the natural language of the document.

meta.name: Content Script Type
meta.desc: Used to specify the default scripting language of the document.

meta.name: Content Type
meta.desc: Used to declare the character set of a website.

meta.name: Content Type Style
meta.desc: The Meta Content Style Type is used to specify the default Cascading Style Sheet (CSS) language for the documents.

meta.name: Copyright
meta.desc: Used to include a copyright, trademark, patent, or other information that pertains to intellectual property.

meta.name: Description
meta.desc: Gives a brief overview of the document.

meta.name: Designer
meta.desc: Used to declare the designer of the website.

meta.name: Distribution
meta.desc: Used to declare the distribution of your web content.

meta.name: Expires
meta.desc: Used to declare the date and time after which the web document should be considered expired.

meta.name: Generator
meta.desc: Used to declare the name and version number of the publishing tool used to create the page.

meta.name: Keywords
meta.desc: List keywords that define the content of the site.

meta.name: Language
meta.desc: Used to declare the language used on the website.

meta.name: MS Smart Tags
meta.desc: The Meta MS Smart tags were part of a beta test of Internet Explorer.

meta.name: MSN (No ODP)
meta.desc: Used for your description in the Bing search results instead of the description used in DMOZ.

meta.name: Yahoo! (No ODP)
meta.desc: Opt-Out for Yahoo Directory titles & descriptions

meta.name: Pragma No Cache
meta.desc: Used to prevent visitors from seeing a cached version of a specific page.

meta.name: Publisher
meta.desc: Used to declare the name and version number of the publishing tool used to create the page.

meta.name: Refresh
meta.desc: Used to specify a delay in seconds before the browser automatically reloads the document or URL specified.

meta.name: Reply To
meta.desc: Used to harvest email addresses. The Meta Reply To tag is a Spammers tag.

meta.name: Resource Type
meta.desc: Used to declare the resource of a page.

meta.name: Revisit After
meta.desc: Used to inform search engines when to return to index your site.

meta.name: Robots
meta.desc: Controls search engine robots on a per-page basis. It tells Robots they may traverse the page, but not index it.

meta.name: Set Cookie
meta.desc: Used to set a cookie in the user's web browser.

meta.name: Subject
meta.desc: Used to declare the subject of the web site.

meta.name: Title
meta.desc: Declare the title of the page.

meta.name: X-UA-Compatible
meta.desc: This meta tag allows web authors to choose what version of Internet Explorer the page should be rendered.

meta.name: Viewport
meta.desc: Changes the logical window size used when displaying a page.

meta.name: Image Toolbar
meta.desc: Facilitate how to handle images and photos when you use Internet Exlorer.

meta.name: DNS Prefetch
meta.desc: DNS Prefetching is a method of informing the browser of domain names referenced on a site so that the client can resolve the DNS for those hosts.

meta.name: Googlebot
meta.desc: Google tag are exclusive for use with Google.
